title: Asynchronous e-Learning Learner Satisfaction Design and Evaluation Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: An instructor competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. A course for pre-service teachers to acquire asynchronous content design and satisfaction survey methods for strengthening language education capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can analyze factors influencing learner satisfaction in asynchronous e-learning design across seven categories.
Learners can modify and apply the LSAeL-based satisfaction survey items to fit language education contexts.
Learners can interpret exploratory factor analysis (EFA) results to suggest directions for improving instructional design.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
